titles.title: When I survey the wondrous cross

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: {lang-eng}When I survey the wondrous cross On which the Prince of glory died, My richest gain I count but loss, And pour contempt on all my pride.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Forbid it, Lord, that I should boast, Save in the death of Christ my God! All the vain things that charm me most, I sacrifice them to His blood.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: {lang-eng}See from His head, His hands, His feet, Sorrow and love flow mingled down! Did e’er such love and sorrow meet, Or thorns compose so rich a crown?{/lang-eng}
